basis: The user explicitly commits to trying today, mentions specific behaviors (2-minute pre-eating pause, flexible hydration, one-tap log, mid-morning reminder, post-dinner check-in), and asks for a log-later/voice-note option, indicating high likelihood of action aligned with the plan.
cognitive_dissonance: Tension between wanting a structured protocol and the need for practicality in social settings; concern about logging while out with friends.
negative_thought_patterns: Occasional perfectionism (feeling pressure to log within 30 minutes); social-eating anxiety; potential self-criticism if a plan isnâ€™t followed exactly.
emotional_triggers: Social occasions, heat, cravings, interruptions, fatigue during the day.
coaching_notes: Keep plans flexible and actionable; offer log-later or voice-note options; validate progress, not perfection; provide quick adjustments for real-life scenarios and encourage self-compassion.
